website_summaries.verdict: These Kidde smoke detectors offer a really low price point and an easy battery installation method, but some customers have reported problems with frequent false alarms when humidity levels change when the seasons change.
pros: Customers report it’s very easy to install
Uses flashing LED to help figure out which detector has low battery
Will connect with other Firex smoke alarms for interconnecting
cons: Doesn’t offer any advanced features or Smart Home network connectivity
Some customers report a frequency of false alarms in certain weather conditions

customer_reviews.title: Bought these to replace expired detectors and so far they ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace expired detectors and so far they work. I ordered the adapters to reduce the install time but you may still need to change the mounting plate. See attached pictures.
customer_reviews.author: pckupman29

customer_reviews.title: False Alarms only in the middle of the night --Dreadful
customer_reviews.text: It's 1:30 a.m. and like many other upset reviewers our household was woken up with yet another Kidde false alarm. This was after recently spending over $300 to replace all the alarms. Our poor dogs and our poor hearts!! Our handyman kept texting us after install asking any false alarms? For 2 months we happily said no. Then tonight. The false alarms only happen in the middle of the night. It's hard to fall back to sleep after hearing "Fire, Fire". We are utterly frustrated with the device. We've read all the instructions--double checked everything--no dust--fresh batteries--good battery install. A true NIGHTMARE
customer_reviews.author: Sheepdog Mama

customer_reviews.title: These things are a nightmare with intermittent chirping at all ...
customer_reviews.text: These things are a nightmare with intermittent chirping at all hours the night, terrifies my dog. did not last 3 months!! Please read all the reviews before buying.
customer_reviews.author: L. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for Firex 120-1182b
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to replace a pair of hardwired Firex 120-1182b smoke detectors in my condo that were awfully chatty whenever I was cooking with my oven above 350 degrees. They've been installed for a couple weeks now and I've cooked with gradually less and less ventilation (sometimes not turning the vent fan on, sometimes not opening a window, etc) - so far no false alarms. To replace the 120-1182b you will need to either re-hardwire the electrical, or purchase the Kidde KA-F adapters ( that snap in (wear gloves, they're tight and it's kind of painful), and replace the bracket that mounts to the ceiling. Don't know why they couldn't just use the same bracket.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: Much Better Design - Well Engineered
customer_reviews.text: We've had this alarms for several months now and are quite happy and pleased. We had to change out each of the receptacles but that was straightforward and simple. We had an older model which didn't use the same plug. The new plug is a much better design. Love that you don't have to take down the alarm to change the battery. Much better design too. Also really appreciate the green light to let you know there is power to each one. And the red one for battery use only and so much more. Ships very quickly - Highly Recommend Engineered
customer_reviews.author: Richard Heward

customer_reviews.title: Constant Nuisance Alarms--Going in the Trash!
customer_reviews.text: We're going to have to throw these away and replace them after less than two months! They keep going off when there is no fire, no smoke, and no good reason to screech. We've since found out that this brand is infamous for nuisance alarms. They were a total waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Underdahl

customer_reviews.title: False alarm
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the other poor reviews before I purchased 8 of these to replace the aging ones throughout my house. I saw the overall rating and figured they were good. Last night I was rudely awaken by the alarm immediately over my bed at 2am. It sounded twice and stopped. Scaring my wife, my dogs and myself to death. I searched the entire house and found no fire or smoke. Then the detector flashed a bright red light every 10 seconds for the rest of the night. NOT HAPPY! I have contacted the company and am waiting for a response. The alarms are just 2 months old.
customer_reviews.author: PaulF

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to put up.
customer_reviews.text: Our neighborhood is 12 years old and a bunch of neighbors are having their detectors fail on them (usually at a very inconvenient hour of the early morning) so I figured I would get ahead of it and replace my detectors before getting a 3am panic wake up when the old ones decide to revolt. These were very easy to replace and took less than 5 minutes each. Stepladder, screwdriver, and basic electrical knowledge (or just watch a quick YouTube video) and you are good to go.
customer_reviews.author: jeremy divers

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Also, dont bother purchasing the adaptors if you are upgrading from older units, just remove the old wire harness and install the new one that comes with the smoke alarm! It is SUPER EASY! There are 3 wires - Black, white and red( sometimes yellow) coming from the junction box that your existing alarms are attached to. Connect each of these to the corresponding wires of the same color with wire nuts and you're done! It is not rocket science! It took me about 30 minutes total to remove 6 old smoke alarms, along with the old wire harnesses and mounting rings and install the new ones in their place.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: False alarms
customer_reviews.text: We did a remodel and they installed 4 of these alarms about 2 years ago. So far, 2 of the 4 have had to be replaced due to false alarms. It's really annoying when they go off scaring us to death at 4 AM or so. There is nothing worse than an alarm that gives false alarms, especially when they make so much noise at the wee hours of the morning. I may go back to a battery only alarm vs. these hardwired units. At least the battery only ones give me a choice between vendors. Kidde/Firex makes alarms that do not function properly.
customer_reviews.author: cm

customer_reviews.title: Kidde has made several changes that make this a poor replacement for the old FireX 120-1182
customer_reviews.text: -2 stars for being a 20 minute installation that should have been a 1 minute install. Kidde has made several changes that make this a poor replacement for the old FireX 120-1182. They changed the mounting plate, so now the old quick mounting plates have to be uninstalled so I can install the new quick mounting plate. They changed the FireX pin connector to the Kidde version. So while this says FireX all over it you're going to need to do some rewiring. Just to make the rewiring part a little more interesting they changed the colors of the wires. I assume it works fine. I just installed it, and luckily my house didn't catch on fire while installing it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Utter crap, these are
customer_reviews.text: False positives every few nights. They seem only to happen at night. We have 9 in our house and a different one gets a blinking red light each time. Utter crap, these are. Our young children are now afraid of sleeping alone. If the power flickers it's almost a guarantee a false positive is coming 30 minutes later. I thus suspect there's an issue with the battery backup switchover. I've tested all my batteries, and they're new and performing to full voltage. The wiring harness did not match my old Firex smoke alarms, either. This wasn't much trouble but still unexpected.
customer_reviews.author: S. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement.
customer_reviews.text: My 40-year-old house was wired for these. Having wired smoke detectors is code where I live. This is the third set (that I know of) in the house. They plug right into the old Kidde plugs. I expect them to last about 10 years before they start chirping as the half-life of the radioactive emitter slows down and the detector interprets this as smoke. This is no different from the functionality of any competitive product. I'm very happy with this brand. Every upgrade is of higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gugel

customer_reviews.title: Worth a Look!
customer_reviews.text: A while back, we decided to replace our hardwired smoke alarms with these Kidde models. We've been very pleased with them: the price was pretty good, installation was relatively easy, and they seem to work well. In fact, we've not had any of the false alarms that some reviews mention. These don't seem to be overly sensitive, but I've found that we've set them off a couple of times with smoke from broiling, but that certainly was not the smoke alarm's fault!
customer_reviews.author: JPfromOH

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Looked for a replacement for my USI Electric 1204 smoke detectors as they hit the 10 year expiration date. Was unsure these would work but took a chance. There are several mounting holes available and one set was a perfect match. All 7 installed very easily. During an alarm these detectors will show which detector set the alarm off, so im looking forward to using this. My old detectors didnt have this feature so whenever i had an alarm I had to run around the house randomly pulling detectors off the wall until i found the culprit!
customer_reviews.author: electron.boy

customer_reviews.title: Simple replacement for a Firex FADC (120-1182C)
customer_reviews.text: It was a relatively simple task to replace a 10 year old Firex FADC with this Kidde i4618. However, neither the three prong AC connector nor the mounting plate is compatible. The AC connector problem is solved by either replacing the old connector with the one supplied with the new smore alarm or by using a Kidde KA-F adapter. The new mounting plate simply has to be screwed to the ceiling/wall. Depending on which set of holes were used when installing the old mounting plate, you may or may not have to move the screws.
customer_reviews.author: T Hull

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have 7 smoke detectors in my house, all hard wired in. I needed to replace all of them since they were all going bad... how do I know this... well being woke up at 2am by all of them going off for no reason at all was a good sign. So since I have so many I needed ones that were going to do the job but werent going to cost an arm and a leg. These are great. I've had them for about a year now and I replaced them all by my self.. no man required!!! :)
customer_reviews.author: NickiV99

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install - if the wires are already in place
customer_reviews.text: The 2 wired smoke detectors in my house went bad at the same time. They were 11 years old. The Kiddie is the replacement detector for the old Firex. I had to switch out the base, but only needed to loosen the 2 screws, old base fell out and then adjusted the new base to fit the screws and tightened. Then attached the wires to the smoke detector (with the power shut off). Twisted it onto to the base, pulled the tab for the battery and the job was done. Easy peasy
customer_reviews.author: itzpatricia

customer_reviews.title: Worth It
customer_reviews.text: We had the same brand previously and they were about 8 years old. They started the random beeping even with new batteries and from what I had read, meant it was malfunctioning. I opted to replace all in the house and at this price, was affordable to do. It was the same brand, but the bracket was different (I'd hoped to just be able to use the old brackets), was enough to install both and plugged right in. No issues, no complaints. Haven't tested with a fire, but that would probably get me in trouble. :D
customer_reviews.author: S. Thorson

customer_reviews.title: chirping noise
customer_reviews.text: It started chirping a few hours after installation - the battery was new and has a long expiration date, the unit was hardwired properly and installed fresh out of the box. I pressed the hush button, took the battery out said the prayer and put it back in. It helped for 12 hours after which the unit started chirping again. So I went on to read about the chirping problems and my search here returned a lot chirped customers. This is not right -- you are selling defective products in the business of human safety. Correct the problem or stop selling this crap.
customer_reviews.author: maria

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: No 2am wakeup from it going off like my other Kiddie alarm (so far). This would be unusual though considering it's brand new. If you look under the poor reviews of most of these types of alarms, they usually always start with the frustrating early morning alert going off. They all have a replace-by date so it's not like they are without their issues and the only other option I have continually seen as a better alternative is the Nest alarm. I typically buy quality but spending $90 or more for one when I would need more than 12 is unrealistic for this type of device. I don't need to be that "up" with technology.
customer_reviews.author: JayRT

customer_reviews.title: constantly goes off at t night
customer_reviews.text: Please take time to read reviews these are complete junk > I bought 6 of them and am now throwing them out. They constantly chirp and its never during the day but always while sleeping. They are very disturbing and no way to fix even after placing new batteries in all of them. Do not waste your time and money. I have no idea why they have such a poor quality control. This product should never have been sold. But don't take my word for it read other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A.

customer_reviews.title: Problematic detectors
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 6 of these first week one started the low battery chirp replaced battery still kept chirping replaced unit and a few weeks later another one started to low battery chirp again replaced battery still no good had to order another manufacturer took weeks to reply back and did not answer my problem or resolve problem I’m having
customer_reviews.author: Dentguy

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: The product came quickly and was what we ordered. Installing was simple. I think it might have taken five minutes to remove the old fire alarm and replace it with the new one. You have to hard wire the new harness on and then attach the alarm. It’s three wires and simple. Nothing else was needed. It works with our other alarms. You just want to make sure you get the same brand you already have in your house so they can work together.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Decent smoke detector for price
customer_reviews.text: Bought a bunch of these to replace the original ones that came in our friends house. Those were super cheap and yellowing. These new ones are a decent upgrade, white and slightly larger. I like that the battery is on top for easy access. These were super easy to install, we just needed to get the Kidde Quick Convert adapters and were set to go. Hoping these don't yellow like the older ones did.
customer_reviews.author: WebPhenom

customer_reviews.title: Excellant Service
customer_reviews.text: One of the two alarms was missing the little A-C pigtail. I called the Kidde support group and they promised to send me one right away. Very easy to deal with and clearly in an Englsh speaking county.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Hill

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to replace Fires with Kidde equivalent
customer_reviews.text: Using the *Kidde KA-F Smoke Detector Quick Convert Adapter from Firex to Kidde* made replacing my old Firex with this Kidde equivalent simple (no electrician required!). Even the new mounting bracket that came with this Kidde model was designed to fit the old Firex bracket screw mounting placement. Just had to loosen the existing screws, remove the old Firex bracket, and slip on the new Kidde bracket. I gave the Kidde i4618C model 4*'s for "Value for money", since the i5000 model has a 10-year vs. the i4618C's 5-year warranty for the very little extra cost. If I had to do it again, I would get the i5000 model.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Plug in plus battery is a winner
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 old plug in, building wired smoke detectors in my condo unit; neither worked well (one didn't work at all) so I took a gamble and tried these. They were easy to install; the old mounting screws fit the new detectors and the plug in the wall box fit perfectly, so I didn't even need to call an electrician to rewire for them. A 5 minute installation job.
customer_reviews.author: L. Finch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Two of my units were chirping, even after changing the batteries, so I replaced all 6. The wiring plug where the old detectors were is different, but it was easy enough to switch them out with a few minutes on the ladder. The battery access is on the front of these new detectors and they are louder than the detectors that came with my house. I have them linked via the wire harness and when one goes off, they all go off. There are more expensive smoke alarms out there, but these seem to do the job they were intended to do.
customer_reviews.author: chuckasaki

customer_reviews.title: Be sure to buy the adapters, as they are not included in the package
customer_reviews.text: Used this to replace the existing FireX detectors that were failing. i did gave to also buy the fireX wiring adapters, as these do not ship with the adapters. I searched and searched the reviews, and no one made it clear if the adapters are included in the package. If you want to use the existing plugs that are in your ceiling, you will need to buy the adapters. Amazon sells them as an add-on item for a very low price.
customer_reviews.author: The Key Master

customer_reviews.title: Working great
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace several hardwired smoke detectors that were over 10 years old. Hoping these would be a direct plug in to replace the older units, I purchased these detectors but alas, the plug shape had changed a bit. Undeterred, I easily hard wired the new pigtails to the junction boxes and mounted these in place of the old ones. They work well with the expected Kidde quality.
customer_reviews.author: JoeyNick

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product as it will not function correctly ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this product as it will not function correctly it randomly goes off with no reason. I've replaced the battery that came with the units as I was eliminating that as being the problem, and it didn't fix the issue still goes off at random. I've also tried resetting the units and still no luck so now I have them uninstalled so we can sleep at night, never buy this brand again. NEVER again!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff E. Peebles

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to intall this smoke detector. I thought I could use the old plug that was already wired, but the new one is slightly different. Not a big deal because replacing the wires was simple. Screws right in where the old detector went. I trust they'll last 10+ years like the old smoke detectors.
customer_reviews.author: jbv

customer_reviews.title: ... (it was time--14 years old) One decided to go bad. So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Replaced all 6 of my detectors about 6 months ago (it was time--14 years old) One decided to go bad. So far so good. Why do they always go bad at 0300 in the morning. I have vaulted ceilings and am too old to be climbing up a ladder in the middle of the night. My dog still hasn't recovered--he hates the noise. He can sleep through sirens, thunder, the doorbell but NOT the smoke alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Replacement
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace an old Kidde unit that was a combo smoke/CO detector. The price for this was spot-on (besides, I think that CO is heavy, so it sinks, making a combo unit worthless). It fit right on the old mounting plate, and wiring clip. Took a whole five minutes to replace.
customer_reviews.author: colnago

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Except the three pin wire plug and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Except the three pin wire plug and mounting base have changed from the one in my house. The one in my house was 10 years old. The product picture makes it look like it is an identical match, but it is not. The base and three wire plug have changed. So now you have to use the new three wire plug and the new mounting base. That will take about 30 minutes to change. Why couldn't they just keep it consistent so it would be easier to replace?
customer_reviews.author: Remo

customer_reviews.title: Had to get an adapter.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to replace an old wired in smoke detector that finally hit the dust. It came quickly and was not difficult to install. It seems to be a good quality and is working well. My only complaint is that this is a newer model and I had to purchase a separate adapter which costs another $6.00 to make it work. I wish it came with an adaptor or gave a better description that an adapter might be needed.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Murphey

customer_reviews.title: Life Safety People
customer_reviews.text: Life Safety People... these are cheap enough to do your in your house for replacements. Or even for new installs. They are easy to install, just use common sense when installing them. Read the directions and test each one when done. Make sure the breaker is off and check the wire nuts for secure ness before closing the hole with the detector. TurThen sleep good at night knowing your family and property are protected.
customer_reviews.author: Jay11

customer_reviews.title: Died Early. Warranty is worthless.
customer_reviews.text: Unit failed after 18 months in service. Started the chirp of death (keeps chirping with new battery and good hardware connection.) The warranty is a joke. It's 5-year but the customer pays shipping both ways so it is cheaper to just buy another unit.
customer_reviews.author: 0xDEADBEEF

customer_reviews.title: Kiddle has changed the quick connect configuration.
customer_reviews.text: To use this alarm with older 5000 series you will have to pull all the interconnected wires, remove the old quick connect adapter and install the new one. A 5-minute job is now an hour if you don't screw up your whole Smoke Alarm system. Also if decide not to do the install you own the alarm as it is not returnable.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Medugno

customer_reviews.title: these newer alarms are better at indicating which alarm has gone off in the ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to replace my expired Firex alarms. They are visually identical, but the plugs were different. Had to unscrew the wiring connectors to swap out the plugs for the new ones that came with the alarms, but that only added a couple extra minutes per alarm to the install. I have not had any false alarms since replacing. Also, these newer alarms are better at indicating which alarm has gone off in the event you do have a false alarm or other "incident", so that you know which one to hush via the button in the center. (husband posting on wife's shared Amazon account)
customer_reviews.author: Andrea and Jeff Weiss

customer_reviews.title: I replaced all 6 smoke alarms because the older ones ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced all 6 smoke alarms because the older ones kept going off. The new ones, do the same thing!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Rentfrow

customer_reviews.title: Easy install as a replacement, even with wire changes
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, less than 5 minutes from removing the old unit and bracket, replacing the wiring, installing the new bracket and unit, then pulling the battery strip out. Unless you have some strange wiring, there is NO NEED FOR ADAPTERS! Usually, everything is just wire nuts, and it is easy (and probably more reliable) to just change the wire harness.
customer_reviews.author: RMH

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfectly as replacement
customer_reviews.text: I guess this is the newer (AC suffix) model. I used it to replace the A suffix model. Plugged in and screwed on in a jiffy. Even came with battery. Only difference is AC is a little more sensitive and also it is not designed for lithium battery.
customer_reviews.author: Aardvark8

customer_reviews.title: Easy. Necessary. Upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Such an easy upgrade. Not only were the old ones yellow but they were way over 10 years old. They were giving false alarms. I blew some compressed air into one and you would not believe the dust that came out. Do yourself and your family a favor and replace your ugly old smoke detectors. These plug right in and even come with a battery.
customer_reviews.author: David Phelps

customer_reviews.title: These were compatible with the existing kidde smoke detectors in my home.
customer_reviews.text: I installed 2 of these smoke detectors in my garage and tied them into the existing smoke detector system in my home after witnessing the aftermath of a garage fire in my neighborhood. My order was delivered within a week. The Kidde detectors that I ordered were compatible with the existing Kidde smoke detectors / system that was originally installed in my home and were provided with straight-forward wiring diagrams for installation. I would definitely order this product again in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: The temporary silencer is a great feature if you have a wife that likes to ...
customer_reviews.text: Setup was a breeze, works as it should. I replaced an old one that refused to sound the alarm when the oven was smokey. This one let's us know immediately, every time, which is what you want because God forbid there's ever a real fire, we need to be notified immediately. The temporary silencer is a great feature if you have a wife that likes to burn food while cooking!!
customer_reviews.author: puzzler

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: Replaced 10 of my old ones throughout my house. So far they work great. No false alarms. Only thing I noticed is they appear to be sensitive to humidity. One near my bathroom will chirp when the door is opened after a shower. Old one never did that. Price was right with these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Perfect addition to the Kidde talking CO&Smoke detector system already present. Added a few of these to the unfinished basement just for extra security. Super easy to install, and they set off the rest of the house with "FIRE" being heard from the talking units.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Kreykes

customer_reviews.title: Smoke alarm
customer_reviews.text: Tried this brand after having several Kidde brand alarms be defective right out of the box. When this happens a chirping alarm can drive you crazy and can be difficult to diagnose since it's new. This brand works like it is supposed to....finally.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Michaels

customer_reviews.title: Good product but use your own batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Great little product but, I bought several Kidde i4618AC over the last 2 years. All good except, 4 of the units that I bought in late 2017, to in install in bedrooms had Kidde branded batteries had the battery failed in the first few months. 3 chirping and one totally dead with no warning.I replaced the batteries. Not good. Good product but use your own batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Gilman

customer_reviews.title: It works and good price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced two 16-year old smoke detectors with two of these. It required replacing the ceiling mount, but that was easy (turn off the power!). They work because something burned slightly in the oven setting one of them off. The smoke was subtle, and not visible, so it is sensitive.
customer_reviews.author: Molon Labe 5.56

customer_reviews.title: Wired with 9 volt backup.
customer_reviews.text: House had similar but 19 year old Kidde's. Had to rewire to the new plug that was included but when that was done smoke detector made easy transition to work with old ones. Not any real problem to do.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: really easy to install - works well - high value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value. you can spend all you want on one of these, and then you can go to value and get the same thing - which is what this is. i installed this in ten minutes, tested it, and then later in the weekend it went off when we had something hot on the stove - so we know it's working well. i wouldn't spend over this amount for one going forward. don't have to
customer_reviews.author: drno

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, pigtail connector was included.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old Kidde model. Was a different plug configuration, so I did have to install the included pigtail adapter before plugging up the unit. Had it installed and working in 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Sun, Sand, Books

customer_reviews.title: Easy install once I realized I had to cut the ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy install once I realized I had to cut the existing wires and tape them to the adapter! :-) Once installed, I've had no problems and they worked perfectly..... when the wife smoked the house while cooking! Allowed me to reset, and gave me enough time to vent the place! Worth the purchase and peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: N Mendez

customer_reviews.title: A great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5 to replace in my one-story ranch style home. They were easy to install and worked immediately. The only thing is that they come with batteries which I didn't know and ordered batteries separately on Amazon. No big deal but just wanted to make that awareness.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for a 14 y.o. unit that gave up the ghost.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Kidde i4618AC Firex smoke alarm (paid $14), and received the $39 Kidde Pi2010 Firex smoke alarm instead! I guess I'll keep it unless they ask for it back ... The unit had a Dec. 2017 manufacture date, so it is as fresh as can be. Installed real easy and replaced a 14 year old model. Has a very nice separate hush button which will be useful, as this alarm is the one that gets any smoke from the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Ron T.

customer_reviews.title: One of the only companies that have units that are ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the only companies that have units that are part of our hardwired system not just individual battery operated alarms and it is also battery powered for the times you might lose power. This is the second installation after buying our house in 2001. One needs to replace alarms every 5-7 years. Common dust builds up in the sensing portion and this disables them over time. Be proactive and you could possibly save your life as well as family members.
customer_reviews.author: Robert John Mathiasen

customer_reviews.title: Defective out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Just a couple of weeks after, already defective beeping non-stop. Fire department came and flagged them as defective. Avoid this specific brand. Tried to contact the Kidde and no answers.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ajot

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Easy Installation
customer_reviews.text: Our existing smoke alarms were starting to malfunction (~14 years old). Not knowing what brand to go with, I chose Kidde as they had high ratings and low prices. We have purchased several of these units over the past year and they have all been terrific! I keep one as a spare for whenever our next smoke alarm starts to go. The included battery seems to be of average quality and I would guess it will last 5 years or so before needing to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Jaguarbamf

customer_reviews.title: Down to Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Installed and working; hopefully I'll never need them (to find out if they do the job right)! I'm finding out that you can use these unless there's a full battery installed!!! I put in a new batter in one (I installed all 3 together, but I've had to replace one battery on 1 alarm several months back and another battery on another alarm this week...) But this second keeps chirping - which according to the manual it means low batter??? Also, according to the manual, you can't use these without a full battery installed even if AC powered...
customer_reviews.author: RTS

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, just plug it into existing wire plug. Green light tells you it is functioning.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because our alarms would randomly go off. I tried replacing batteries and that did not work, so after testing alarms, I found one was no longer working and this fixed the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works well. Noisey when it needs to be.
customer_reviews.text: They are working fine. I needed a detector that could turn on the son-alert in the other detector to alarm the whole house. They tested well. This one is just in the hall acting somewhat like a duct detector as there is an air vent above the door for air-flow from the back of the house to the front.
customer_reviews.author: Flicker

customer_reviews.title: Great WIRED option to replace older versions of the same brand!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great to replace older version of same brand. Didn’t have to rewire anything. Removed old plate and simply added new plate and connected new units. Only took 3-5 min to replace each one, as WIRED units.
customer_reviews.author: M. Murdock

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Went off when we were cooking sausage, was easy to silence and reset. Great product. **UPDATE** Do NOT use the battery that came with this smoke alarm. We did, and it didn't even last 10 weeks. Which is horrible, because it makes the most annoying chirp every thirty seconds when the battery needs to be replaced. It woke us up at 5am. Buy 9-volts from a reputable battery company to save your ears and your sleep.
customer_reviews.author: maulable

customer_reviews.title: base plate??
customer_reviews.text: Great, Works fine, good price, received as promised. only problem is that it did not lock into original kiddie base plate which should be totally compatable. had to fiddle but seems as if it did not fully lock.
customer_reviews.author: MARG

customer_reviews.title: Faulty and goes off in the middle of the night!!
customer_reviews.text: These work great until one goes faulty, and then they get set off (always in the middle of the night) and keep going off randomly until you disconnect it from the wiring. We had the same issues with our old set, but they were very old. We've only had these for just over 1 year. Why don't these chirp like normal smoke detectors???
customer_reviews.author: Torri T

customer_reviews.title: easy to install if you buy the universal adapter
customer_reviews.text: great price, easy to install, but one of 6 had a dead battery, so I replaced all 6 with new Duracell's. should have suggested that I buy universal adapter. I bought the adapters separately, piece of cake to install all
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Mcpherson

customer_reviews.title: Very good unit.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding replacement to older model. Looks nice and new battery design is great. Sturdy and would buy again. Easy to hardwire. I used the Kidde adapter (sold separately ) so as to not have to retire all,of my replacements.Green steady light for power indication and flashing red light every 40 seconds to indicate system is active.
customer_reviews.author: rdkmco

customer_reviews.title: GAH! - were more than one year old
customer_reviews.text: Overall seems fine and wires were compatible with a 10+ year old model for easy replacement. However, the mounting had changed so that had to be replaced, but that is easy to do. I knocked off two stars out of annoyance that they were just over a year old when I received them.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with mounting hardware!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these, they were not sent with mounting screws, or wire nuts ! Made me waste my time going out to get them. I have put in a lot of fire detectors and these are the only ones I've ever seen that didn't come with the mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought these to replace my older ones (10+ years same ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace my older ones (10+ years same model). Fast shipping and well packaged but I only gave it a three stars because the date on the product was 9/2016. It's already 2 plus years old. I thought of returning it but decided to keep it. Check the date on the back of the detector.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: This is a reliable product.
customer_reviews.text: I hope I never have to use this smoke detector but I like the kidde products so ordered this to replace two that are over ten years old
customer_reviews.author: hitchingpostfarm

customer_reviews.title: It was over a year old when I got it.
customer_reviews.text: I received this Oct 3rd 2019 from Amazon, it was manufactured Aug 8th 2018. Most likely will try and find a place to purchase next six I need local so I can check the date. To be honest I am not sure if the date matters but if I am reading right I now get to change them in 9 years not ten, LOL. They are an easy replacement for the Firex 120-1182 B. Loosen the wire nuts, and replace with wire that is in kit, replace with the bracket for the ceiling mount, (2 screws) and snap back in the new detector. Maybe 5 minutes per detector max I would think.
customer_reviews.author: James E. Burke

customer_reviews.title: REPLACE BATTERY IMMEDIATELY
customer_reviews.text: Only 2 weeks installed and alarms went off 2:00 AM due to low battery regular 9V batteries are not suggested only takes Kidde 9 volt battery for smoke Alarms No.1604P Home Depot carries smoke alarms but not batteries try Walmart for special battery replacement. Batteries in smoke expire in 2 years but not good trust me replace right away save yourself sleep!!!!!! Hoping there is not a manufacturing problem with product????
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Mind
customer_reviews.text: So pleased. I purchased a different brand prior and was concerned about the quality so I went and bought several of these. So relieved they just look like they are made well and gave me piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Kylee

customer_reviews.title: KIdde Smoke Detectors - UL listing
customer_reviews.text: This unit is UL listed not just following UL standards (and NFPA standards) for smoke detectors. Easy to install and test. Great design with the battery door on front. Major box stores and some retail stores only have detectors (and not just Kidde) which are not UL listed. Watch for the UL symbol on the back of the unit. It is a better product in quality due to Approval Lab testing and manufacturing followup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super simple to install with the included wire nuts
customer_reviews.text: Super simple to install with the included wire nuts. Could have been even easier if Kidde hadn't changed their wire plug arrangement from 1999! Who would have figured that they would make a change in 18 years. Like slow down there a little Kidde. Moving too fast for me...
customer_reviews.author: DanGH

customer_reviews.title: Easy replacement for Kidde
customer_reviews.text: I replaced older Kidde smoke detectors with this model. Even reconnecting the wiring was easy, taking less than 15 minutes for each. The front loading battery is much better that the old model. The mounting rings went up in exactly the same place and the detector was the same size. They also connected without issue. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: PJ / MJ

customer_reviews.title: Nicely designed hardwired smoke alarm
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, I am a DIY with some electrical experience, took about 10 minutes, love the front door for the battery, makes replacement extremely easy without removing the entire unit from its mount, seems to not have any false alarms so far. I'm happy with this purchase and would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Big Blue Fan

customer_reviews.title: Every ten years whether you need it or not.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know that one needs to change their Smoke detectors every 10 years. Now I do. Needed to change wiring harness from the older Kidde style to the new. Whey do we need the change? This made replacement of each detector at least twice as long.
customer_reviews.author: ThinkBob

customer_reviews.title: This may not be identical to the unit you are replacing
customer_reviews.text: This is the same brand that is installed in my house. Unfortunately, the plate and wire connections are different so I have to totally remove the old unit. Our ceiling is over 9' and it is a bit more work than I anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: JVG

customer_reviews.title: Easy install
customer_reviews.text: They were a little different than my old ones so had to replace the base and electrical connectors on each one. Still pretty simple
customer_reviews.author: kevin learned

customer_reviews.title: Good Smoke Alarm
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a defective, eight year old smoke alarm. This one works fine. It was easy to install. It has been in place for two weeks and is quiet. The light is green and all is well. Nice product at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Forstater

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I bought these smoke detectors to replace my old ones. They were easy to install, linked together easily, came with everything that was needed. I'm not sure how well they detect smoke, but so far I'd consider them a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Junk - False Alarms at Night
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in September of 2017. It likes to go off in the middle of the night for no reason. Date on the back on this one is 2017 Feb 13 As this is junk I guess I'll try another brand this time. I tried to contact them, filled out the form and IT WILL NOT SUBMIT the form.... Bad Firex
customer_reviews.author: J. Man

customer_reviews.title: NOT THE SIZE ADVERTISED BY A LONG SHOT
customer_reviews.text: Listed dimensions are TOTALLY WRONG. This smoke alarm is 5 5/8" across, nothing like the larger dimensions listed. I was looking for a large alarm to cover an old one's footprint. This is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: La Boheme

customer_reviews.title: Good product and excellent customer support
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I bought a smoke/co alarm form Kidde about 3 years ago, and it went malfunctioning. Kidde replaced it immediately. Excellent customer support
customer_reviews.author: Virginian

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, nice clean look with front-loading battery compartment.
customer_reviews.text: Package came with everything I needed, and was easy to install. Front battery compartment makes maintenance simple. This detector is wired with the house, so if you'red not comfortable splicing wires for the plug, this detector is either not for you, or you'll need a hand installing it. For a handy individual who has spliced a wire before, just use wire nuts, and it's simple.
customer_reviews.author: jjm

customer_reviews.title: Kidde quality
customer_reviews.text: Replaced all my fire detectors with this model , my house has existing wiring had to purchase adapters , they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Install was easy but did require that I replace the original base ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 6 for the entire house to replace the original ones which were 11 years old and beginning to break down and chirp for no reason. Install was easy but did require that I replace the original base with the new base which come with the alarm, since the new alarms did not match up the the old base. They are attractive, as smoke alarms go, and the backup battery replacement will be easy as they slide out without removing the alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry A

customer_reviews.title: good product and fit for purpose
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and activate, comes with 9 volt battery. Replaced 20 year old alarms and the existing connectors plugged right into the units on a multi-unit integrated system
customer_reviews.author: Firewalker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use/install
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace older models. Once they arrived I realized I also needed to replace the adapter plug in portion. Directions were very easy to follow. Will be buying these again if still available in future.
customer_reviews.author: R.B.

customer_reviews.title: Buying more! Work awesome
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, easy to install and work perfectly. Our old ones have been hit n miss and today I cooked bacon and a small amount of smoke set them off loud and clear. Nice to know they work and we will be protected just in case!
customer_reviews.author: JakeTop Contributor: Swimming

customer_reviews.title: Included batteries are dead
customer_reviews.text: They install nice, cheaper than home depot, but the included batteries were all dead. Beeping low battery after between a few hours from install to a few days. So, when you factor in the price of a bunch of batteries, home depot ones would have been cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Direct Replacement
customer_reviews.text: These are a direct replacement for the wired detectors that are in our house. Very easy to install. Our current detectors are nearing the end of their 10yr lifespan and were beeping randomly or from steam from the shower. No issues since replacing them.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Quite for hours and beeps for hours - extremely annoying!! Not sure if there is a warranty ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortumately the unit only last about one year. Purchased in late June 2016 and by July 2017 it was acting up. It beeps even with new battery but in an inconsistent manner. Quite for hours and beeps for hours - extremely annoying!! Not sure if there is a warranty on it but not sure it is worth the time since its less than $15. I think possibly the original unit was already dated - these units only have a lifetime from manufacturing of about 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Naleway

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: Probably a lower stared device but the installation was easy and haven't had any problems going off yet. Replaced an old Firex, as they were bought out by Kidde. Kidde is of not use support wise in that case. Bought this and easy replace. I like not having to wrap wire coil into the end caps.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Taylor

customer_reviews.title: perfect replacement. hardwire, with battery backup, easy to install. clean look.
customer_reviews.text: almost exact same is what i was replacing. comes with a battery too. the one i was replacing was not sensing the backup battery properly due to corrosion on the crummy metal. there are about 8 in the house that remain working properly but after 12 years chucking one bad one is not the worst. $14.97 shipped to door in 2 days (prime) is a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: sc

product_meta.title: Kidde 21026063 AC Hardwired Smoke Detector Alarm with 9V Back up and Front Load Battery Door
feature_bullets: Easy Installation - Front battery pull tab allows battery activation without removing alarm from mounting bracket. Large mounting base makes mounting easier, protects surface paint from dirt and covers imperfections. Pre-stripped wiring harness with easy off cap does not require stripper tool. Tinned strands increase conductivity and wire nut grip.
Fewer callbacks - Large centrally located Test/Hush alarm control button. Dust cover protects sensor from contaminates during construction reducing nuisance alarms.

User-friendly features - Easy access front loading battery door. Battery backup provides protection in case of power failure. Interconnectable with up to 24 devices (of which 18 can be initiating) including smoke, CO and heat alarms. See user’s guide for complete instructions.
Alarm memory flashes red LED indicating which unit was the initiating alarm in interconnected system. Temperature range: 40 degree Fahrenheit to 100 degree Fahrenheit
Tamper resist locking feature deters alarm theft. Audio Alarm-85dB at 10feet
